Class GroceryList

java.lang.Object
t2.gl.GroceryList
public class GroceryList extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    GroceryList()
    Constructor for the class GroceryList Initialize member groceryList array of the GroceryItemOrder[] Type Initialize member variable (type int) groceryListCount to 0 Initialize member variable (type double) totalCost to 0.00

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(t2.gio.GroceryItemOrder Item)
    This method copy to value of the properties of the Object in the parameter of a GroceryItemOrder type into the properties of an element in the groceryListArray in a sense adding an item into the array by copying the information The member variable groceryListCount is increment by 1 every time an item is added until it reaches the count of 10 which is the size of the array.
    void
    displayGroceryList()
    Create a visual display of the items in the groceryList array Including each element's properties' value such as name, quantity, price It calls getCost() to get the value of how much in total each item cost and displays it.
    double

    setTotalCost()
    This method set the member variable of totalCost by recalculating it and renewing the value of totalCost every time this method is called totalCost is the Total of the Cost of buying all the items on the groceryList

  • Constructor Details

    • GroceryList

      public GroceryList()
      Constructor for the class GroceryList Initialize member groceryList array of the GroceryItemOrder[] Type Initialize member variable (type int) groceryListCount to 0 Initialize member variable (type double) totalCost to 0.00

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(t2.gio.GroceryItemOrder Item)
      This method copy to value of the properties of the Object in the parameter of a GroceryItemOrder type into the properties of an element in the groceryListArray in a sense adding an item into the array by copying the information The member variable groceryListCount is increment by 1 every time an item is added until it reaches the count of 10 which is the size of the array. At that point no more item is added. And the method prints out "GroceryList is Full" to the Console.
      Parameters:
      Item - -- Object variable is of the GroceryItemOrder Type

    • setTotalCost

      public void setTotalCost()
      This method set the member variable of totalCost by recalculating it and renewing the value of totalCost every time this method is called totalCost is the Total of the Cost of buying all the items on the groceryList

    • getTotalCost

      public double getTotalCost()
      This method first called the method setTotalCost() and then return totalCost setTotalCost()
      Returns:
      totalCost --member variable that is of the double type totalCost is the Total of the Cost of buying all the items on the groceryList

      Parameters:

      ch - --character to fill up the space padding
      L - -- an Integer used in this method to determine the length of spaces to right pad the (input) String

    • displayGroceryList

      public void displayGroceryList()
      Create a visual display of the items in the groceryList array Including each element's properties' value such as name, quantity, price It calls getCost() to get the value of how much in total each item cost and displays it. It calls getTotalCost() to get the value of how much in total all of the items added together and displays it at the bottom
